title: nazanin zaghari ratcliffe could home
story: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe could be home for ChristmasUK hands £m to IranTehran has signalled it might accept the payment in Covid jabs and medicines, the charity workers husband Richard Ratclfe told the Sunday Mirror Image: Getty ImagesByNigel NelsonPolitical Editor:,  Dec | commentsCharity worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe could be home for Christmas -Britain hands over the £million it owes Iran. And Tehran signalled two weeks ago it might accept the payment in Covid jabs and medicines which would count as humanitarian aid. In an exclusive interview Nazanin’s husband Richard Ratclfe said: “All countries need vaccines. If the offer was worth more than £million Iran could be interested. “Andwe settled this debt Nazainin could be released the next day. It would be an amazing Christmas present for her to be home.” But as things stand Richard and daughter, Gabriella, , will spend their sixth Christmas without Nazanin despite his  day hunger strike outside the Foreign Office last month. Richard added: “Nazanin has been very blue these past few days, as the realisation has hit her that we are drting again. “But Gabriella has had a happy time decorating the tree and helping me put up lights. After the intensity of the hunger strike, it is also nice to have some good times.”  Nazanin, , has been detained in Iran since April,  and was sentenced to five years over spying charges. She now faces another one year jail term. Britain claims she is being held hostage with other dual nationals as the two countries wrangle over money. Ministers admit the cash is owed for battle tanks never delivered but keep coming up with dferent excuses not to pay it. In March Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said the UK’s refusal to cough up was “a stain on Britain’s honour”. Now he says the money can only be paid“a practicable and legally-viable means” can be found. Foreign Office minister Lord Zac Goldsmith said last month to pay would be ransom money. He added: “Payment of any money becomes payment for a hostage. That is not in our current, medium or long-term interests.” Richard said: “His comments were legally illiterate and irresponsible for the message it sent to Iran. “Ministers cannot throw out words like “hostage” and “ransom” when they just want to deflect Parliamentary scrutiny. “My fear is that the debt is also leverage for the UK side - using it to push Iran into the nuclear deal or something  - and Nazanin has become a bargaining chip for both sides.” Middle East minister James Cleverly refuses to talk about negotiations saying he “will not comment further as discussions are ongoing.” Foreign Secretary Liz Truss had meetings with Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir-Abdollahian on th November and another with his deputy Bagheri Kani three days later without any resolution.  In  Iran ordered , Chieftain battle tanks and  repair vehicles costing £million from Britain. Only  tanks were delivered before the  Iranian revolution overthrew the Shah and pitched the country into the hands of Islamic clerics and Britain banned arms sales. When new Iranian leader Ayatollah Khomeini asked for a £million refund to make up for the missing weaponry Britain refused to hand it over. Yet in  the international court in The Hague ordered Britain to repay the money which is still sitting in an independent trust in the UK. Iran now wants £million in interest which Britain will not pay either. Britain has argued the money cannot be repaid because Iran is under UN sanctions - yet that did not stop America coughing up a similar sum to release four American prisoners in . And former Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said: “We are a country that pays its debts.”Mrs Zaghari-Ratclfe’s family have said she was repeatedly told that her arrest was linked with the debt that the UK owes. Richard has now been on two hunger strikes - the first two years ago outside London’s Iranian Embassy - but he is not about to embark on a third. He said: “They put a real strain on the family, as well as on my body. So none planned for a while, and hopefully none needed.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSMiddle EastUnited NationsForeign OfficeJames CleverlyAyatollah Ruhollah KhomeiniZac GoldsmithJeremy HuntNazanin Zaghari-RatclfeLiz TrussPrisonsIranChristmas partyDebtHandsTribunals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news politics new-covid-rules-week-work-"Boris Johnson details emergency booster plans for UKByRachel WearmouthSenior Political Correspondent:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsAll adults in England will be offered Covid boosters by New Yearaposs Eve as Boris Johnson announced a rapid acceleration of the jabs rollout to battle the Omicron tidal wave. Addressing the nation last night, the Prime Minister said the country was facing an emergency in our battle with the new iant - and two jabs will not be enough to protect people. He warned that Omicron could rip through an un-boosted population, overwhelming the NHS and leading to very many deaths. Covid restrictions are also being ramped up after scientists discovered the new Omicron iant is much more transmissible and spreading rapidly across the UK.It comes after Boris Johnson announced last week that England would move to the Governmentaposs Plan B measures. Epidemiologists fear the iant could cause , deaths by April and that the NHS could be overwhelmed as Omicron looks set to overtake Delta as the dominant iant within days. UK Health Security Agencyadviser Dr Susan Hopkins warned of a looming wave of infections - and said more measures may be needed. She said: Itaposs inevitable that weaposre going to see a big wave of infections. What we are not yet clear on, and which is what we are basically making sure people go out and get their vaccination for, is how much that will affect hospitals.  So, what do the latest Covid curbs mean for you  Hereaposs the latest. Working from home People in England are being urged to work from home where possible from today. This is aimed at reducing contacts. The furlough scheme has not ed, however, as no businesses are being shut down at this stage. The advice is to work from home aposwhere you canapos. Face masks New rules brought into force last Friday mean that anyone aged  or over must wear a face mask to enter a wide range of indoor venues. These include places such as cinemas, casinos and bowling alleys. The full list:community centres , youth centres, members clubs and social clubs libraries and public reading rooms shops public transport polling stations and premises used for the counting of votes places of worship crematoria and burial ground chapels visitor attractions and entertainment venuespublic areas in hotels and hostels indoor areas of sports stadiumsPubs, bars and nightclubs are exempt. There is also an exemption for singing, which applies to, for example, congregations and choirs. Technically, a person could avoid wearing a face mask by singing, but the Government has warned protestors attempting to abuse this rule will be stoped. Daily testing for Covid contacts  From tomorrow, double-jabbed people who come into contact with an infected person will be told to take daily lateral flow tests for seven days instead of isolating. The new advice applies to all cases of Covid, regardless of whether it is the Omicron iant or other strains. Unvaccinated adults must continue to self-isolate for  daysthey are a contact of someone with Covid.This means strict rules forcing people identied as close contacts of Omicron cases to isolate for  days are being scrapped. Care homes From Wednesday, there will be a new restriction on care home visits. Care home residents will be asked to pick three people to visit and one essential care worker. Covid passports From Wednesday, England could be facing the introduction of mandatory covid passes proving your vaccination status to enter some venues, including nightclubs.So a punter could have proof of double jabbed status or, under the new pass rules, a text message or email from the NHS showing a lateral flow result to get into a venue.Firms failing to check Covid passes properly may be fined £, and up to £, for repeat offences.But Boris Johnson is facing a major backlash to the plan as Tory backbenchers look set to vote against the plan. The PM may get the changes though parliament with Labour support but given he is under major pressure over the Christmas parties plan, the rules could be watered down.  So far, there are no limits on travel, household mixing and meeting groups of people. Downing Street has also rejected calls to put new restrictions on hospitality venues, so your Christmas party can still go ahead. What about a aposPlan Capos  Officially, there is no Plan C. The Prime Ministeraposs official spokesman said on Friday there were no plans to go beyond what weaposve set out already.But Omicron could change things, and Health Secretary Sajid Javid is under pressure to bring in more stringent measures before Christmas.Further measures could include hospitality check-ins, tougher isolation rules, face masks in all indoor venues and further vaccine passport rules. title: top lawyer not convinced boris
story: Top lawyer not convinced Boris Johnson Xmas quiz was exempt from Covid lawsAdam Wagner,Barrister and Visiting Professor of Law at Goldsmiths University of London, walks the Sunday Mirror through what a police officer who happened upon the No Christmas Quiz might have done Image: SIPA USA PA ImagesAnalysisByAdam Wagner:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsIt’s useful to think what a police officer who happened upon the No  Christmas quiz in December  would have done. Let’s assume the officer found groups of ying sizes, including one room with - people, participating in a Christmas quiz, with alcohol, which led to drinks later and mingling between offices. On  December , London was in Tier . Under paragraph  of Schedule  to the “All Tiers” regulations, no person could participate in a gathering indoors of two or more people. The officer would have considered possible exceptions. The first relevant one is a “permitted organised gathering”, under paragraph . But that could only workpeople participated alone or in household groups. That doesn’t seem to apply here. The second is that the gathering was “reasonably necessary for work” under paragraph . Maybe the civil servants would say that they needed the quiz for morale, or had to stay at work to run the government.  The officer might think: well, what is “reasonably necessary” for an office is a bit subjective. But the government told us exactly what they thought was “reasonably necessary for work” – their own guidance at the time said “you must not have a work Christmas lunch or party, where that is a primarily social activity”. So that seems to exclude the work exception. The final question is whether No.  was somehow exempt from the Covid regulations. Lawyers have been debating this. I’m not convinced. I think the “crown property” exemption was about government buildings, not people. And I doubt that people could say they were doing their duties as crown servants and therefore exemptthey were doing things which the government had advised everyone not to do – and which broke the law. As for the Prime Minister – he appears to have been taking part in a social gathering indoors of more than one person, so may well have breached the regulations too. title: we need pull out stops
story: We need to pull out the stops on boosters before Omicron wave reaches its peakGet your booster to make sure that everyone can enjoy Christmas safely this year, as well as protecting our NHS, writes Shadow Health Secretary Wes Streeting Image: Getty ImagesopinionByWes Streeting:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | comments Scientists are learning more about the new Omicron iant of the Covid- virus every day, but we know for certain that it is spreading, it is spreading fast and it has now resulted in people being admitted to hospital.We also know the best defence against Omicron is the booster jab. That’s why I’m asking Mirror readers to get yourselves boosted as soon as you can – andyou haven’t had your first or second jab yet, it’s not too late to do that either! Three doses provide much better protection for you and the people around you against this new iant. Getting Britain boosted will help us protect the NHS as they approach their winter peak and it will also help us to minimise the disruption caused to people’s lives, livelihoods and liberties as a result of restrictions.  We need to pull out all the stops on this. The next few weeks are crucialwe are to get Britain boosted before the Omicron wave hits its peak. That’s why we support the Government’s ambition to get every adult vaccinated by the end of this month. We’ve asked them to put a rocket under the booster rollout and they’ve listened. It’s a big ambition. Vaccination on this scale has never been achieved before. But the NHS will be moving heaven and earth to pull it off and they’ll have Labour’s full support. Let’s make sure they know we’re all behind them. All of us have a part to play. The vaccine is safe and effective. I’ve had my first two jabs and I’ll be getting my booster this week. We want to make sure that everyone can enjoy Christmas safely this year, as well as protecting our NHS. So let’s boost Britain as a Christmas present for our country. title: amazon doorbell uses recognition system
story: Amazon doorbell that uses a recognition system to remember callers branded worryingTech giant has been granted patent for doorbell that remembers regular callers and alerts residents when a stranger is approaching but privacy campaigners see it is a worrying developmentValuable tech or invasive snooping  Image: Getty ImagesByMartin Fricker:,  Dec | commentsAmazon is working on a video doorbell that remembers regular callers and sends an alert when outsiders approach.The “visitor recognition system” would also be able to flag suspicious cars and even animals whichnenter a selected area.Amazon, which owns doorbell brand Ring, wants to use articial intelligence to analyse faces, hair colour, height, weight and clothing. It could also detect the make, model and colour of vehicles and identy pets, according to documents lodged with the European Patent Office. Footage could be compared with stored images and other data such as the time of visit, to decide whether visitors are known. If an unknown guest or unusual activity triggered the system, a security alert would then be ­automatically sent to the owner’s phone. A monitoring centre would also be alerted to a potential breach and could then call ­security guards or the police. According to the Sunday Times, the system can check records with other doorbells.  Amazon’s patent application, System and method for visitor detection algorithm, was given approval in the US in October. Charity Privacy International, which fights technology abuse, called it “worrying”. Ring said it did not use facial ­recognition in devices and the features in the patent were not “in development or in use”.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Amazon" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: brit makes worlds biggest crisp
story: Brit makes the worlds biggest crisp advent calendar with a shocking , caloriesThe huge calendar has a gut-wrenching , calories and five £ notes hidden behind doors that will be donated to charityA company made a ft crisp filled advent calendarByCharlotte Penketh-KingRachel HowarthLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Dec | commentsA man has made a ft crisp advent calendar that has a whopping , calories in total. The giant calendar can only be opened with a ladder and also has £ cheques behind five doors which winners can donate to a charity of their choice.It was made by Skelmersdale signwriting company Envision Media due to their company directoraposs love of building big festive treats, reports LancashireLive. Last year director Andy Phillips, , made the worldaposs biggest selection box a .m long treat with  sweets and , calories. Heaposs inviting customers and suppliers to come to their HQ in Skelmersdale, to open a door. Andy reckons its the worldaposs biggest crisp advent calendar. Read More He said: I’ve never been a big fan of chocolate, and those who know me will know about my crisp obsession. Iaposve always said I would love to have a crisp advent calendar, so this year, the team made my dreams come true! Every Christmas, we produce a novelty oversized confectionery item to reflect our large format print offering. Weaposve previously created a giant Toblerone which needed a hacksaw to chop up, and last year, we made the worldaposs biggest selection box which raised £, for Alder Hey Childrenaposs Charity. This year, we wanted to do something even bigger and better. title: children young five offered covid
story: Children as young as five to be offered Covid jab as kids are driving up casesThe NHS is reportedly planning to roll out jabs to five-year-olds after SAGE scientists warned in the summer that kids were the key drivers of coronavirus infectionsThe NHS is reportedly preparing to roll out vaccines to primary school children Image: PAByChiara FiorilloNews ReporterLizzy BuchanDeputy Online Political Editor:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | comments Primary school children could be offered coronavirus vaccines due to fears that kids are driving up the number of Covid- cases in the UK. The NHS is reportedly planning to roll out jabs to children as young as fivethe plan is approved by regulators.According to leaked documents, parental consent will be needed for kids aged between  and -years-old, and the environment in which they receive their jabs will need to be appropriate. Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi did not rule out the move, saying that there was no plan at the moment to extend the jabs rollout to younger children. There have already been reports of cases of the new Omicron iant in schools, including one in Kent. Over the summer, SAGE experts warned that children were driving adult infections around the country.  In September, NHS England began rolling out vaccines for children aged between  and -years-old.Now, health officials could go even further and offer jabs to younger kids, with a decision likely to be made in the coming weeks, according to The Sunday Times.The Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agencyis expected to announce that jabs are safe for children, while the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationis examining whether to recommend vaccines for kids. Mr Zahawi said the JCVI is still looking at the evidence as to what level of protection Covid- vaccines would offer primary school children. He told Sky Newsapos Trevor Phillips On Sunday: There is no plan at the moment to vaccinate primary school children for the reason that the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationis still looking at the evidence as to what level of protection it would offer those children.  He added: The most important thing is to boost the most vulnerable - that is absolutely the priority. Mr Zahawi said he would do everything in my power to keep schools open - but could not rule out future closures. Asked to rule it out, he told the Andrew Marr Show: We are absolutely working to make sure that all schools are open, that theyaposre protected. I will do everything in my power. We are still learning about this iant. We know that a booster works. Get boosted, protect yourself, protect your community and letaposs get through this and transition this from pandemic to endemic. Under existing rules, vaccines are administered by the school immunisation service, with heads responsible for ensuring parents and children get information leaflets, consent forms and invitation letters. Parents are asked to give consent, although some older children are able to overrule their parentsthey are deemed competent to make their own decisions. This is unlikely to occur in very young children. Earlier this week, Professor John Edmunds, a member of Sage, called for jabs to be rolled out to five to -year-olds as soon as a licence is given. He said: This wave of the epidemic that we’ve had since June — the Delta wave — has been driven really by school-age children. Every child who is infected will expose an adult. They all live at home with adults. So from that, transmission can occur. The European Medicines Agencyapproved the use of the Pfizer vaccine for children aged - in May and for children aged five to  in November. An MHRA spokesperson said: Pfizer has stated that they are applying to the MHRA for an extension to their Covid- vaccine authorisation that would allow use in five to -year-olds. Further details on the timing of this submission would be for Pfizer to provide. We are committed to providing safe, timely access to treatment for UK patients, and will continue to prioritise our Covid- evaluations. This includes any decision on use in under-s. Any such decision would be subject to our robust regulatory standards. In the meantime, we are looking at the data from other countries to ensure that when an application is received, we are making the best decision for children in the UK. Due to the fast spread of the new Omicron iant, booster jabs will be available to millions more people in England this week.The national booking system will open to everyone aged  to  from Monday so they can make appointments to get a booster three months on from their second coronavirus jab.The move comes amid concerns the UK is facing a major wave of infections in January, with scientists warning up to , people could die of Covid- in the next five monthsfurther restrictions are not introduced. Experts from the London School of Hygiene  Tropical Medicinesaid tougher measures may be needed to prevent Omicron from causing a high number of hospitalisations and deaths.The scientists, who advise the government, said the new Covid- strain could cause between , to , deaths in England over the next five months. title: christmas day weather forecasters predict
story: Christmas Day weather: Forecasters predict temperatures will plummet in festive weekThe south of England and Wales could have a white holiday season as temperatures plummet on Christmas Eve. Frost and fog will sweep across the country on the big day.Snow in South Lanarkshire earlier this weekByLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Dec | commentsBritons are braced for a chilly Christmas as forecasters predict frost to grip the country. During the festive week, temperatures in the south of England and Wales will plummet on Christmas Eve, just in time. While frost and fog will sweep across the country on Christmas Day.People in the North West will have slightly milder weather on December . In the last week of the year, the weather will be settled yet cold for many, The Sun reports.The Met Office said: Temperatures are expected to be near normal for most, but milder in the northwest and perhaps turning rather cold in the south in time for Christmas.  It is likely to remain settled for the final week of , with an increasing risk of frost and fog for Christmas and New Year. While itaposs too early to tellBritain will see a blanket of snow during the holidays - forecasters can predict this accurately five days prior - snow is more likely between January and March than in December. On average, snow or sleet is expected to fall an average . days in December, compared to . days in January. While snow was recorded last Christmas, only four percent of British weather stations recorded snow lying on the ground.There has only been a widespread covering of snow on the ground - where more than % of stations in the UK reported snow on the ground at  am - four times since —in , ,  and , the Met Office reports. Before the cold weather, Britons will have unseasonably warm weather, will mild temperatures at the start of next week. title: couple spruce up tired home
story: Couple spruce up their tired home and add £k to its value with Facebook bargainsSavvy couple Ewelina and Przemek Mejka snapped up online bargains to reduce the cost of kitchen fittings, furnishings and materials to transform their home in just six weeks.The couples home hadnt been touched for  yearsByLata YedroudjLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsCouple who added £k to their old, tired property scoured the internet for second-hand goods to dramatically slash the cost of the renovation. Ewelina Mejka, , and her husband Przemek, from Rugby, bought a home together after they got married but didn’t have the funds to purchase a new build.They bought a ‘doer upper’ three-bedroom property for £, and renovated the entire house with minimal help from professional tradesmen, reports CoventryLive. Ewelina, who works as a carer, told CoventryLive: We decided after we got married that we wanted to buy a house, but we didnapost get enough mortgage to buy a house where nothing  needed to be done. So we started to look for a house to renovate and thataposs how it all started. I love the boho style and fortunately my husband does too. Przemek took time off work to help with the renovation and the couple worked tirelessly from morning until late evenings to get the job done. First, Ewelina and Przemek ripped off all the old wallpaper in the rooms and replaced the floors, bathroom and entire kitchen. However, they hired workers to fit new windows and doors, and to install a boiler. They managed to get a brand new Ikea kitchen set for free and assembled it themselves.  Ewelina purchased most of the materials from Facebook marketplace and scoured the internet for bargains, cutting their costs dramatically. Their entire home renovation cost £, - raising the value of their home to £,. With the help of friends and family, the couple managed to finish the renovation work in just six weeks.Speaking about the process, Ewelina, said: My husband took time off from work and we both sat there from morning until evening. We were helped a lot by family and friends, without them it would not have been possible to finish renovating the whole house in six weeks. The entire house was renovated from top to bottom.  She added: I knew from the start that I wanted to decorate the house in this style. There are natural colours and accessories throughout the house. Ewelina found all the materials on the internet to be cheap and of good quality. Most of the new furniture was sourced from Facebook Marketplace. They put together the kitchen they bought from Ikea to cut the assembly cost in half. It is certainly not an easy job and you need a lot of free time to do it yourself, but you can save a lot of money this way. Many things can be bought on the internet for half the price than in a shop, but you have to start looking earlier. Sometimes furniture from Facebook marketplace only needs to be sanded and painted to look like new. title: covid booster available 30 year
story: Covid booster available for -year-olds from Monday amid Omicron deaths warningThe booster programme is being rolled out to younger age groups in a bid to tackle soaring coronavirus infections and fears the Omicron iant could cause a new surge in JanuaryThe booster programme will provide millions of people across the country with a third vaccine dose to increase protection Image: Andy Commins   Daily MirrorByCatherine WylieSam Rkaina:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsPeople aged  and over will be able to book a Covid- booster jab from Monday in England. The national booking system will open to everyone aged  to  so that they can arrange to get the top-up jab three months on from their second dose.The extension of the NHS vaccine programme comes as scientists advising the Government warned that tougher Covid restrictions may be needed to prevent the Omicron iant causing anywhere between , to , deaths in England over the next five months.NHS England said the rollout has been accelerated in the face of Omicron, with data from UKHSA suggesting that booster doses give good protection against the new iant. People can make their booking two months on from their second dose - a month in advance of becoming eligible to receive the jab.  There are around . million people aged  to , and . million of those are eligible from Monday. Dr Emily Lawson, head of the NHS Covid- vaccination programme, said: Following the updated guidance from the JCVI, which shortened the interval between second and booster doses, NHS staff are redoubling their efforts to protect the public from the virus. The NHS vaccination programme, the biggest and most successful in health service history, will from tomorrow offer top-up jabs to everyone aged  and over three months from their second jab. With the emergence of the new iant and the rising case numbers, there has never been a more important time to get boosted. So, when itaposs your turn, come forward and book in. The vaccine programme has been designed and delivered by NHS staff but it could not have been rolled out so quickly without the support of our fabulous volunteers. So,you are interested in helping us, we have roles available - from marshalling car parks as a volunteer or taking on a paid role in admin or as a vaccinator, please do look at the opportunities available. You would be helping us to save lives. Health and Social Care Secretary Sajid Javid said: The Covid- booster programme is accelerating rapidly and more than  million people in the UK have already received their top-up, securing vital protection ahead of Christmas.This is our national mission - the most recent data shows boosters are the essential defence against Omicron and we are doing everything in our power to get jabs into arms as quickly as possible. We are now expanding the offer to over-s - so please come forward as quickly as possible to get boosted and help our country get ahead in this race with the iant. Experts from the London School of Hygiene  Tropical Medicine , who also sit on the Scientic Pandemic Influenza Group on Modellingor the Scientic Advisory Group for Emergencies , used experimental data to look at how Omicron may transmit as the country heads into , and predicted a large wave of infections in January. On Friday, analysis by the UK Health Security Agencyfound that the AstraZeneca and Pfizer vaccines provided much lower levels of protection against symptomatic infection with Omicron compared with Delta. But the UKHSA said a booster dose gives around % to % protection against symptomatic infection with Omicron, as it urged people to have their boosters. news uk-news first-omicron-symptom-seen--"Omicron iant will dominate Delta before Christmas says expertByDaniel SmithLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Dec | commentsScientists say a common symptom reported by people who fall ill with Omicron is a dry cough accompanied by a ‘scratchy throat’. Anecdotal reports follow a large outbreak of the Covid iant in the UK.The Centers for Disease Control and Preventionhas been part of a concerted effort to understand Omicron after it was classied as a iant of concern by the World Health Organisation last month, WalesOnline reports. The strain spreads far faster than previous iants, although so far few hospitalisations have been reported.In itsMorbidity and Mortality Weekly Report , researchers at the CDC have put forward a preliminary symptom profile for Omicron.The report states that a cough is the most common symptom, afflicting  percent of those infected. The authors of the CDC wrote: “Many of the first reported cases of Omicron iant infection appear to be mild, although as with all iants, a lag exists between infection and more severe outcomes.” “Symptoms would be expected to be milder in vaccinated persons and those with previous SARS-CoV- infection than in unvaccinated persons.  “Characteristics of the cases described in this report might also not be generalisable because case findings might be associated with inidual characteristics. The details of the report draw on the cases of  infections attributed to the Omicron strains. Only seven percent of subjects presented with ‘asymptomatic’ infection or ‘unknown’ symptoms, with  percent of cases deemed symptomatic. “Evenmost infections are mild, a highly transmissible iant could result in enough cases to overwhelm health systems,” wrote the authors where in the report. The report lists cough , fatigueand congestion or runny noseas the three most common symptoms. Shortness of breath , diarrhoeaand loss of taste or smellall featured at the bottom of the CDC’s list. title: geminid meteor shower light up
story: Geminid meteor shower to light up sky with celestial display of shooting stars on MondayThe stellar display is expected to peak some time during the night of December  and will be visible into the early morning of December This Geminid meteor shower from  make for some spectacular sights Image: PAByNina Massey:,  Dec | commentsSkygazers will be treated to a celestial display of shooting stars on Monday, as the Geminid meteor shower illuminates the night skies. The display, which s every December, is expected to peak some time during the night of December  and will be visible into the early morning of December . Meteors are pieces of debris that enter Earthaposs atmosphere at speeds of up to km per second, vaporising and causing the streaks of light we call meteors. Geminids are very bright, moderately fast, and are unusual in being multi-coloured. They are mainly white, some yellow and a few green, red and blue, partly caused by the presence of traces of metals like sodium and calcium - the same elements that are used to make fireworks colourful.  The shower is known to produce more than  meteors an hour at its peak, although light pollution and other factors mean that in reality the actual number visible is far fewer. The source of the shooting stars is a stream of debris left behind by the asteroid  Phaethon, making this one of the only major showers not to originate from a comet.  Skygazers will be able to see the display with the naked eye so there is no need for binoculars or a telescope. It is best not to look directly at the radiant as this can limit the number of meteors people can see. Instead, people should look just to the side in a dark area of sky for a better chance of seeing the display. title: grieving girlfriend never forget young
story: Grieving girlfriend will never forget young sailor found dead at nuclear naval baseThe body of engineering technician Stephen Cashman was discovered at Faslane Naval Base in Scotland on Thursday afternoon, with police called to the scene and, as yet, unable to explain his deathOfficers are currently treating the -year-old’s death as ‘unexplained’ pending the results of a post mortem examination Image: PABySarah VestyLeigh Mcmanus:,  Dec | commentsThe girlfriend of a young sailor found dead at a British naval base has written a heartbreaking tribute in his memory, saying she will never forget him. The body of engineering technician Stephen Cashman was discovered at Faslane Naval Base in Scotland on Thursday afternoon, with police called to the scene.Officers are currently treating the -year-old’s death as ‘unexplained’ pending the results of a post mortem examination, reports the Daily Record. Faslane, the home of Britainaposs nuclear weapons, on the Gare Loch, is one of three operating bases in the United Kingdom for the Royal Navy and is the navyaposs headquarters in Scotland. Got a story  Email webnews@mirror  Royal Navy chiefs yesterday confirmed Stephen, who is understood to be from the Liverpool area, had died. His devastated girlfriend Faye Walker has now written a moving tribute to him and vowed to keep his memory alive. She said: “I will always get that shop you always told me to get boo. I will get that first in uni that you always knew I’d get. “I’ll buy our dream home we started saving for. I’ll keep my appointment for our tattoos and get my bloody driving license. “I promise I’ll walk Bear when I can Ino how much she meant to you. I will never Lilahy forget you. I mean how can I  “She doesn’t shut up about you best stepdad in the world to her even of a morning when she runs in looking for you for her morning cuddle. She will know you’re here. “I know your shoes will walk me there every step of the way and they will travel with us everywhere we planned to go. I promise boo I promise.  “I will keep the motivation and ecstasy feeling you gave me every day in my heart to carry on. Even when I was at my lowest you was the only soul to ever get me through. “I promise this isn’t sweet dreams yet. I know youaposre with me forever and mine forever. For the first time in my le, I felt love and home in my heart. “Thank you for being mine and your Lilahy’s world. We love you my guy, you won’t ever be forgotten. You won’t ever be lonely because I know that’s what hurt you most. “I know you’ll hold my hand and keep giving me those signs. Every time I hear a rev I’ll know it you boo. I’ll still take Lilahy to see the cars for you. I’ll play our songs till the end comes.  “Your light will never go dull, your love will never change. Will always be our three red hearts so happy. I love you my guy, my happily ever after, my forever and always. I love you.” A spokesperson for the Royal Navy confirmed the tragic death on Saturday and said their thoughts were with all those who knew and loved Stephen. They said: “It is with great sadness that we can confirm Engineering Technician Stephen Cashman died on Thursday  December. “Our thoughts and sympathies are with Stephen’s family and friends at this dficult time and we request that their privacy is respected.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Royal NavyArmed forces" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: john lewis removes childs lolita
story: John Lewis removes childs Lolita party dress from sale after backlash over nameTelevision presenter and writer Victoria Coren Mitchell tweeted about the dress to her k followers before the giant retailer removed the dresses and issued an apologyThe dress was removed from saleByKelly-Ann MillsReporterDaniel Smith:,  Dec | commentsRetail giant John Lewis has pulled a childaposs party dress from its shelves and online store after being slammed stocking it due to its name.The Chi Chi London Lollita Party Dress was on sale for children aged three to  years old on the John Lewis website for £, Hull Live reports.The name is similar to Vladimir Nabokov’s  novel Lolita, which details child sex abuse. It outlines how a middle-aged professor abuses a -year-old girl. The description of the dress read: “This dress is sure to become a partywear favourite. “Lined with satin for a soft and comfortable finish, this pretty dress features delicate metallic embroidery, scalloped edges and a chfon skirt with tulle underlay that’s perfect for twirling on the dance floor.” Chi Chi London is a fashion brand that stocks its clothes with the department store. The dress does not appear on the company’s website either. Television presenter and writer Victoria Coren Mitchell tweeted about the dress to her , followers.  She said: “If you were going to think of a name for a child’s party dress, what would you NOT call it ” Replying to her tweet, one person said: “That’s grotesque and vile.” Another person added: “I would not be able to buy it with that name. Crazy to call it that. The dress is very pretty but I couldn’t.”One Twitter user stated it was dferent to the novel due to having two “ls” in the name.A John Lewis spokeswoman said: “We removed this product from sale as soon as it was brought to our attention and we apologise for the upset caused.”The retailer had already received criticism this week for selling a £ Christmas Tree made of  single-use balloons.Environmentalist were unhappy with some left speechless over the decision to stock it. news uk-news kate-middletons-christmas-day-outfit-"Royal family leaves Christmas Day service in SandringhamByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Dec | commentsRoyal fans are hoping to see the Queen, Charles, Camilla, the Cambridges and the rest of the family making their traditional walk to church on Christmas morning this year. In , in line with lockdown restrictions, they were forced to spend the day apart without their usual royal routines.If restrictions allow, The Firm will head to Sandringham later this month to join the Queen for her first Christmas without her beloved husband, Prince Philip.If they do, itaposs likely theyaposll all join together to attend the morning service at St Mary Magdalene - chatting to well-wishers afterwards. Prince George and Princess Charlotte joined their family for the church service for the first time in , stealing the show as they mingled crowds. However mum Kate admitted she had a huge regret from the special day - her outfit choice. Kate colour coordinated the familyaposs outfits as normal, matching her green accessories to her daughteraposs smart coat. While fans around the world loved their style, it turns out that Kate really regretted her outfit choice for the day, and even told one well-wisher she really shouldnapost have worn it. She looked gorgeous in a heavy grey Catherine Walker coat, with a green hat, bag and heels.But during a quick chat with -year-old fan Rachel Anvil, she admitted it was the wrong choice for the weather. Rachelaposs mother told the: Kate was talking to my daughter about clothes and how she was feeling too hot, she said aposI really shouldn’t have worn thisapos.I’m there talking to Charlotte about dolls and my daughter’s talking about fashion with Kate. It wasn’t fake it was a genuine discussion, it was about a minute but it was tailored to my daughter, it was like speaking to a friend. They are totally dferent with the public. Charlotte charmed well-wishers at the church service, chatting and smiling at her mumaposs side. She also stopped to hug Gemma Clark, who has cerebral palsy, in her wheelchair while holding a pink flamingo. The -year-old had travelled from Long Sutton in Lincolnshire with her family. She said: “It was amazing. I’ve been waiting for this day for a long time. I’ve never seen the Royal Family before. She gave Kate some roses and Charlotte an inflatable flamingo and said she seemed pleased with the gt. “She said aposThank youapos, Ms Clark said, adding that the flamingo was called Felicity. “But Charlotte may call it whatever she likes now.” “It was a birthday present,” she explained. My sister bought me it for my birthday and I truthfully didnapost like it but we have adventures with her.” She said George and Charlotte were “brilliant”, adding: “This is my first time at Sandringham and I would love to do it again.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Prince GeorgeKate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrincess CharlotteRoyal FamilyCerebral palsyAccessories" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: law student uses revision textbooks
story: Law student uses revision textbooks to sue landlord over unfit university hallsJack Simm spent a year fighting the case and has now won. He said winning the case at a civil court last month was perfect revision for his undergraduate law degreeJack Simm has won his first court case while still at university Image: Jack Simm   SWNSByBen TurnerChiara FiorilloNews Reporter:,  Dec | comments A law student has used his revision textbooks to sue his landlord over his unfit university halls, winning his first-ever court case at the age of .Jack Simm sued his landlord for an alleged breach of contract over his flat being like a construction site when he first moved in September . The undergraduate student, who was then a fresher and is now in his second year at the University of East Anglia , spent a year fighting the case and has now won. He said winning the case at a civil court last month was perfect revision for his law degree. Before his one-hour hearing, Jack referred to statutes and case law that he had learnt in his studies to build a -page legal claim for a refund on his deposit and first monthaposs rent - amounting to £. Jack successfully sued the company behind Velocity Student accommodation for breach of contract following a string of problems with the accommodation.  The student, who is also a rugby player at the university, said: Itaposs the best bit of revision Iaposve ever done. Funnily enough while the case was going on I was studying contract law so I flipped open the textbook and went over the notes.I was in a real situation with real consequences. I was thrown into the deep end.Winning shows that I can do it. Itaposs given me a massive confidence boost.Jack argued that his landlord was in breach of contract as the first-year accommodation in Norwich, Norfolk was not fit to be lived in. He claimed there was no heating or Wi-Fi, dust everywhere and builders still working in the accommodation, which Jack did not visit before arriving as he joined UEA through clearing just days before the start of term.  Jack left the halls and stopped paying his rent after just a week as the landlord didnapost recty the issues - and then started building his legal case. The undergrad from Newcastle said: We drove down and arrived at this place and it looked more like a construction site than a place to live. In my room the floor was covered in dust and there were loud noises from people hammering away. It was freezing at night with no heating. A smell was coming out of nowhere. We gave the landlord a week to sort everything out and at the end nothing had been resolved so I moved out and handed my keys in. Jack added: Other people are more lenient and they just get taken through the long grass [by complaining]. I thought aposIaposm not being taken for a fool.apos The most taxing part was making sure the case was tight. I kept tweaking the case right up until the court date. On November , Newcastle County Court ruled in Jackaposs favour and ordered that he be paid £ to cover his deposit and first monthaposs rent. The court also ordered the landlords to pay £ in court fees. The accommodation was developed by the Freedman Project LLP and managed by a company called Estateducation. The respondent in the case was Freedman Project LLP - landlord for the purpose-built student accommodation at , Velocity Student - , St. Mildreds Road.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON University of East AngliaEducationCourt case" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: love islands olivia bowen calls
story: Love Islands Olivia Bowen calls for French bulldog owners to do betterThe reality tv star has two Frenchies called Reggie and Winnie, who she shares with husband Alex - and is asking dog owners to take a stand against bad breeding of the popular bulldogsOlivia and Alex Bowen snuggle with their dog Image: InstagramByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Dec | comments A former Love Island star has called for French bulldog owners to ‘do better’ after sharing a series of shocking Instagram stories with her followers.Olivia Bowen, who came second on the  series with now-husband Alex, owns two Frenchies herself - but is asking people to stand together against the mutation of the breed. She warned her .million followers of some graphic content on her social media stories, showing images of a French bulldog having surgery to remove excess skin above their nose in order to breathe better. She wrote: “This is what you would be buying into. These breeders make themselves look like they care, make themselves look professional and make us think they are reputable. “If they are breeding Frenchies with excess skin, they are donating to this.”  In another image displaying a French bulldog with a surgical scar on their face, she implored dog lovers to do better. The -year-old wrote: “This is NOT cute. We need to do better. “A wrinkly snout may be ‘cute’ when they’re a puppy, but surgery and scars isn’t.” Olivia advised those looking to buy a French bulldog to look out for nice wide nostrils and least excess skin. She added: “I know these are things sometimes we miss and never think about, but we know now and need to stand together against this mutilation of the breed.”  TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. Search through hundreds of recommended walks, treats, toys and places to stay when youaposre on an adventure together. From dog-friendly pubs to product reviews and the latest news, you can snf it all out at TeamDogs. The reality show star has often been vocal in educating people about the breed and their health issues - particularly when Reggie needed Brachycephalic Obstructive Airway Syndromesurgery in .Following Reggie’s trip to the vets, she told her Twitter followers: “I’m so shocked at how many bulldog pug owners don’t know anything about the breed they own or in particular BOAS. It actually baffles me. We knew this day may come Reggie and we knew what it may cost. Brachycephalic breeds are not easy. Educate.”The warnings come as French bulldogs have rapidly grown in popularity over the course of the pandemic, and are one of the most common flat-faced brachycephalic breeds - which now account for a fth of the UK’s dogs. But public demand for Frenchies, and other flat-faced breeds – such as pugs, Boston terriers and English bulldogs – has led to a vicious cycle of overbreeding, causing many of them to be born with countless painful and le-limiting conditions.Leading pet charityBlue Crossrevealed that in the last two years alone, their vets have treated over , flat-faced pets, many of which were French bulldogs.Becky Thwaites, head of public affairs at Blue Cross, said: “Blue Cross are delighted to see Olivia Bowen using her  to raise awareness of the countless health issues that many flat-faced breeds like French bulldogs are suffering from, as a result of overbreeding due to public demand. “French bulldogs, alongside other flat-faced breeds like pugs and Persian cats – are highly sought after due to their quirky look and flat noses which are considered cute. Due to their fashionable status, prospective pet owners and breeders strive to attain an unnatural beauty standard, leading to a whole host of health issues, from breathing problems to eye disease, skin disease, heart conditions, spinal abnormalities and joint disease.  “At Blue Cross, we hope that by educating owners about the health issues associated with these pets the popularity and unrealistic beauty ideals these innocent pets face will be reduced, in favour of healthier breeding practices where the welfare of the animal, and not it’s appearance, will be front of mind. We never want anyone to feel blamed or shamed for sharing their lives with one of these pets - but we as a society must start doing what is best for the welfare of our four-legged friends.” Earlier this year, the charity launched their #EndTheTrend campaign, which asked brands to pledge to phase out the use of brachycephalic breeds in marketing material by .They installed mock advertisements in  high-profile train stations in London, including Charing Cross, London Bridge, St Pancras, Victoria and Waterloo, and launched a petition which members of the public can sign to urge their favourite brands to commit to this pledge. The petition can be found here:www.bluecross.org.uk endthetrendRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsBlue CrossLove IslandAnimalsDogs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: primark employee shares store christmas
story: Primark employee shares store Christmas secrets - including best Boxing Day bargainsA Primark employee named Megan has shared her top tips for any upcoming Christmas shopping sprees at the high street store and even dished on the best Boxing Day bargainsA Primark employee has shared Christmas shopping secretsImage: Dinendra Haria SOPA Images REX ShutterstockByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsLetaposs face it, shopping at Primark can be rather stressful on a regular day out, let alone at Christmas.Butyouaposre keen to complete your present purchasing at the high street store, then one employee has shared some shopping tips and secrets that might prove very useful for you. Known only as Megan, the member of staff claims to have worked at Primark for nearly six years, starting her job there in .The -year-old from Chelmsford said sheaposs currently employed as a retail assistant and works as part of the delivery team, helping to put new stock out on the shelves.Speaking to Fabulous, she revealed that shoppers donapost realise how fast stock actually sells out, saying that some of the items she puts out can be snapped up within minutes during the festive season. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She told the publication that the storeaposs busiest shopping times are usually between am and pm - so youaposll probably want to avoid this period when youaposre out Christmas shopping. Instead she believes the best time to get your hands on a must-have item is at Primarkaposs opening time on a weekday. Megan explained: In our store, we have deliveries Monday to Saturday so there is new stock nearly everyday. On Sundays, employees fill from the stock room so the shop floor is always stocked.  We get a delivery at am which is worked as soon as it comes off the lorry so the best time to come in would be as soon as the shop opens as that’s when the newest, latest stuff will be out in the full size range, she continued. Another useful tip from Megan is to avoid shopping at the weekendsyou can. My top tip is to go in early and avoid weekends, Saturdays especially. Alsoyouaposre in need of something, ask a staff member and they will advise you with what you want or show you where something is. She adds thatyou are going to shop during the busy times, remember many staff are working extra hours over Christmas and itaposs hard for them too.  When it comes to the Boxing Day sales, the same advice applies - shop early to avoid being disappointed.In terms of bargains, Megan says there will be reductions all over the store, but itaposs the ladieswear section where youaposll find the biggest price cuts. The employee added that this is the time to go to find something you missed out on when shopping previously, as they have more designated stock come in especially for the hectic Boxing Day Sales.Do you have a Primark story to share  We want to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-harrys-moving-letter-heros-"Prince Harry and Meghan attend veterans gala in New YorkBySean Rayment:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsPrince Harry has told of his dismay at no longer being able to help veterans after being stripped of his military titles. The Duke of Sussex made the disclosure in an emotional letter to the family of a fallen comrade, who are fighting to have their son’s name on the national Armed Forces Memorial.The parents of decorated soldier Nathan Hunt had turned in ­desperation to the Duke of Sussex to get their son the lasting honour.Nathan served with Harry in Afghanistan in  but took his own le in  after suffering from severe mental health problems thought to be linked to his military service. In an official letter bearing his ­distinctive logo, Harry said he wishes he could help... “had I been in the same role I once was”.  Although Nathan was a serving warrant officer when he died, defence chiefs have ruled that his name should not be added to the memorial.The family told the Sunday People that Harry’s letter begins by thanking the family for writing to him and sharing what they were trying to achieve in memorialising Nathan’s le.They said Harry then writes that it was an honour to serve alongside many exceptional men and women, and that he was proud to have met Nathan as one of them. Harry adds: “I deeply empathise with what your family is going through and so wish I could assist formally, had I been in the same role I once was.” Before stepping down as a working royal and moving to Calornia with we Meghan, Harry was Captain General of the Royal Marines. After  years in the Army he launched the Invictus Games in , an international sporting event for ­injured personnel and veterans. The prince took part in expeditions with the Walking with the Wounded charity and followed in his mother’s footsteps by becoming a patron to the Halo Trust charity, which helps clear landmines. Last February it was announced that he would give up his position with the Royal Marines along with other honorary military titles. But he remains patron of Invictus and other good causes – and his public support for war-damaged veterans has resonated with many survivors of the Iraq and Afghan conflicts.  The family says Harry told them Nathan’s dedication and service is “indelible” and that he will forever remember Nathan as a hero. They say he wrote: “Grief can be a long and burdensome road. “Please know you and your family remain in my thoughts.”Derek Hunt, , and we Maria, , wrote to Harry last month explaining that the Ministry of Defence had twice refused to add Nathan’s name to the memorial in Staffordshire, despite his record for bravery.Harry and Meghan met the Hunts in  during a ceremony to mark the th anniversary of the First World War.  Harry hugged Maria at the event and he and Meghan said how sorry they were to lean of Nathan’s death.Derek, from Lincoln, told how he was deeply moved by Prince Harry ’s letter.He said: “I think the letter shows how much Harry cared about Nathan. He described Nathan as a hero and I think he is very sympathetic to our cause of trying to get Nathan’s name on the memorial. “I didn’t expect a response but after the article appeared in the Sunday People and we sent a letter, someone from his office contacted us and said that Harry would be responding. “I know he has had a tough time in the UK but I don’t care about any of that. You can see from the letter that Harry still cares about the armed forces andhe was able to he would use his influence to help get Nathan’s name on the memorial.” Colonel Richard Kemp, a former infantry commander, added: “Most retired soldiers and officers never forget their service and those they served alongside and will often do whatever they can to help each other after they have left the forces. “Prince Harry is no exception, as this letter shows. Harry deployed on two tours in Afghanistan and fought to do so against great pressure from the Government and resistance from within his own family. For this and his hard work for wounded soldiers – including creating the Invictus Games – he was deeply respected and admired by servicemen and veterans.” Nathan served alongside Harry in  in Helmand as part of a bomb search team in a desert reconnaissance unit while attached to the prince’s Household Cavalry regiment. He was a Royal Engineers Warrant Officer when he died aged . He was found hanged at home in Lincoln on January , . His parents insist Nathan should be included on the memorial, alongside , killed in action or from disease since the end of the Second World War.  Derek said: “Nathan risked his le almost every day in Afghanistan and his actions saved the lives of many soldiers. But it took a toll. He was mentally wounded and those wounds took his le. He was a casualty of war. “The very least the Ministry of Defence could do would be to add his name. Prince Harry appreciated the sacrice Nathan made, it’s just a shame that the MoD can’t do the same. I can’t understand why they are being so heartless. “I don’t want Nathan to be forgotten. I want his daughter to be able to visit the wall, see his name and say, ‘That’s my daddy’.” The names of three other soldiers who served in Afghanistan and died after taking their own lives are on the memorial in Staffordshire. A psychiatric report produced after Nathan died said he had experienced “traumatic exposure” in Afghanistan and had “some elements of PTSD.”  But defence chiefs have ruled that “on the balance of probabilities’ Nathan’s mental health and subsequent death was not linked to his  years of military service. During his six months in Afghanistan the soldier received a Mention in Dispatches. The citation for his award described him as “a superb example of leadership, professionalism and a fantastic ambassador to his corps.” The MoD said: “Every suicide is a tragedy and deeply felt within the defence community. Our thoughts remain with the family and friends of WO Nathan Hunt. “Careful consideration is given to each case and the decision not to include WO Hunt’s name on the Armed Forces Memorial does not detract from his service in the Army.” It added: “We are eternally grateful for his service.” Hero braved bombs peril When he served with Harry in , Nathan had one of the most dangerous jobs in the Army. His role was to search for home-made Taliban roadside bombs in Helmand. One wrong move could have resulted in death or serious injury. Then a Lance Sergeant, Nathan always insisted that he should be the main searcher because of his experience, even though others in his team were also trained to detect bombs.  During his six months in Afghanistan he found numerous homemade devices and carried out searches of roads and tracks while being watched and occasionally attacked by the Taliban. The citation for his Mention In Dispatches, reads: “Lance Sgt Hunt has shown exemplary behaviour and a very good example to all. “He demonstrates selfless commitment time and again, putting himself at greater risk to provide the security for the squadron in the face of a very lethal and hidden enemy.” During his  years of Army service, Nathan, a married father of one daughter, also completed tours of Iraq, Northern Ireland and Kosovo.  taken their lives since  Up to  soldiers and veterans are believed to have taken their own lives since . In reality the number of deaths is probably higher because no government body officially records the grim toll. That means no one knows why so many have killed themselves. Many of those who died were suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder and had been medically discharged from the Army after serving in Iraq and Afghanistan. Other veterans developed mental health conditions such as depression and severe anxiety.  Soldiers who served with distinction on the front line struggled to cope with le on civvy street. Many lost their jobs, watched their marriages crumble and turned to drink. It is not surprising that the regiments which suffered the highest casualties in Afghanistan – such as the Rles – also have the highest rates of suicide amongst veterans. The Sunday People began its Save Our Soldiers Campaign when it became clear that veterans with mental health problems were being failed by the Government. Although the access to mental health support for veterans has improved, the number of suicides continues to rise. So far this year at least  have died.  Former Army Warrant Officer Jim Wilde, a founder of Veterans United Against Suicide, said much more needs to be done to reduce suicide rates amongst veterans. He said: “There have been at least  deaths this year but the real number is probably far higher. Many were veterans of the Iraq and Afghanistan wars and went on to develop mental health issues. “The fact that the MoD has no idea how many veterans are taking their lives every year is shameful. “Once the size of the problem is known people can set about trying to find a solution. Until then many more members of the military community will take their own lives. “Sadly, this is a time of year when our losses increase due to a sense of isolation many veterans feel.” *If youaposre struggling and need to talk, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . Alternatively, you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit their site to find your local branch Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Prince HarryBritish ArmyRoyal MarinesMinistry of DefenceWorld War Royal FamilySoldiersArmed forcesMental healthSunday People" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pub landlord uses customers track
story: Pub landlord uses customers Track and Trace details to send her creepy textJames Karran, who owns St Cannas Alehouse in Cardf, Wales, issued a statement saying he was "sorry for letting down the community" in his conduct towards a woman who visited the pub last monthJames Karran, landlord of St Cannas ale house, Canton, Cardf Image: WalesOnline Rob BrowneByConor GogartyLeigh Mcmanus:,  Dec | commentsA pub landlord has apologised for sending a creepy message to a customer who had provided her number for Track and Trace.James Karran, who owns St Cannaaposs Alehouse in Cardf, Wales, issued a statement saying he was sorry for letting down the community in his conduct towards a woman who visited the pub last month, Wales Online reported. He messaged her at .pm on November : Just so you know youaposve got a super pretty face so youaposre allowed to not wear a mask at the bar. Everyone  must wear one.The following day, the womanaposs partner posted on Facebook : St. Cannaaposs Ale House thanks for deleting my review on your page. Last night my partner was a victim of GDPR breach.Have you been a victim of a similar incident  Email webnews@mirror  She went into this establishment, filled out the Track and Trace without thinking anything of it. She proceeded to order a drink at the bar, but the barman owner James told her to remove the mask as he couldn’t hear her apparently, but only for this man to see what she looked like. Then [he] took her details from the Track and Trace sheet and messaged her illegally. My partner then left the establishment as soon as she had this creepy text from the owner manager. The customeraposs partner sent Mr Karran a message accusing him of absolutely awful behaviour and a data breach. The landlord replied: My profound apologies. No excuse, but Iaposve [sic] so sorry for doing this to you and your girlfriend. I promise this will not happen again but can I please askyou wonapost take it further. Iaposm so so sorry.  The post sparked heavy criticism of St Cannaaposs on social media but the pub did not issue a statement on the incident until Friday morning .The business posted on Twitter : St Cannaaposs has always been known as a safe place to be, but recently that reputation has become tarnished. To grow and improve for the future we will be launching a series of positive initiatives aimed at re-establishing our reputation for safety and welcome to all.These will include: becoming accredited with the Good Night Out Campaign implementing a apossafer spacesapos policy overhauling our business practices around the management and prevention of Covid supporting the charity Womenaposs Aid throughout , including initially donating one whole Saturday nightaposs takings. We cannot change the past but we hope people will see the actions we have taken, and continue to support this small business as it plays its role in the local community. title: queen left dark over prince
story: Exclusive: Queen left in dark over Prince Andrews defence strategy as sex case loomsPrince Andrew vehemently denies sexually assaulting Virginia Giuffre and sources say he has been less than forthcoming over how he will battle the allegations despite the Queen paying his hefty legal fees In this file photo taken on November ,  Britains Prince Andrew, Duke of York arrives for the ASEAN Business and Investment Summit in Bangkok on the sidelines of the th Association of Southeast Asian NationsSummit" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _FILES-US-BRITAIN-ROYALS-ASSAULT-COURT.jpg" width"" "" Prince Andrew has always denied the claims Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Dec Prince Andrew has left senior Royals “in the dark” over his defence strategy on sex claims, say insiders. Andrew is understood to have had “little or no discussion” with the Queen, Prince Charles or Prince William – despite Her Majesty paying his hefty legal fees. Sources say the Duke of York has been “less than forthcoming” over how he will battle allegations from Virginia Giuffre. Insiders suggest preparations have been coloured by reported infighting between Andrew’s UK solicitor Gary Bloxsome and his newly hired Hollywood hotshot lawyer Andrew Brettler, due to a “severe clash in personalities”. The Duke is accused of sexually assaulting Ms Giuffre on three occasions in , when she was allegedly trafficked by the late Jeffrey Epstein.  The claims come as the trial of his alleged fixer Ghislaine Maxwell continues in New York. Virginia, , is suing for damages in a separate action in the US. The Duke, , has always strongly denied any wrongdoing and vehemently denies the claims. He said in a  BBC interview: “I can absolutelycategorically tell you it never happened.” Andrew’s team must deliver final submissions on Monday. A judge will rule whether a trial is held. One impeccably placed source said: “Everyone from the very top has been left in the dark. The fact there has been little or no discussion with senior members of the family is just mind-boggling.” Buckingham Palace had no comment. A spokesperson for Andrew did not comment.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Buckingham PalaceGhislaine MaxwellPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkPrince WilliamPrince Charles, Prince of WalesRoyal FamilySunday MirrorVirginia Roberts" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: savage reviews americans left after
story: The savage reviews Americans have left after eating fish and chips in the UKAmericans described traditional fish and chips as greasy, soggy and funky alongside five star reviews from local Brits who raved about their takeaway.What Americans really think about British fish and chips Image: Getty Images Image SourceByLaura SharmanFreelance writerHarry Higginson:,  Dec | commentsAmericaaposs opinion on British fish and chips has been revealed from the good to the bad and the ugly. The seaside treat is a must for tourists wanting to sample the local cuisine but has received mixed reviews from US foodies who are often baffled by the combo. A string of online reviews described the battered delicacy as funky, soggy and frankly not as good as US copycats despite getting five star ratings from British diners. Reviewer Jsscbly said he was left thoroughly disappointed after taking a visiting friend from America to Fishbone Grill in Birchington, Kent, which has an overall rating of .. He wrote on Tripadvisor: I canapost understand why this place has so many good reviews. The portion size is good and mushy peas ok. Thataposs about it. Chips were not cooked properly. Fish was very greasy and the batter was thick and stodgy and tasted funky. Really disappointed and wonapost be back.  This is contrary to recent local reviews praising the chippy for its fresh and tasty food and excellent service. TripAdvisor user TracyS was also unimpressed after taking US friends for fish and chips, this time venturing to the Michelin-starred Whitstable Oyster Company restaurant in Whitstable. She said the £. cod was overpriced and served with soggy, greasy chips which, quite frankly, our local take-away chip shop makes a better job of.American diner Jen B was also left unsatisfied at Castle Take-Away in Dover, reports Kent Live.We ate here recently as we were told this was the best in Dover. We paid for the Sea Bass at £ but I agree with other reviews that it was good but the portion did seem small for the price. A bit greasy as well but it did taste good. It was not all doom and gloom however, with some America reviewers bucking the trend. RLCRobert described it as the best ever fish-n-chips meal which he sampled during a -day cruise around the British Isles. If youaposd like a beer with your meal, simply walk half a block to the small corner market store, and by the time you , your BEST EVER fish-n-chips meal will be ready for you, he penned. The staff is super friendly, the portions quite filling, and perfectly cooked with a light batter. You will not be disappointed. news uk-news shocking-footage-shows-hunter-hurl-"Sickening clip captures hunter throwing cats body over fenceByLaura SharmanFreelance writerBen Turner:,  Dec | commentsThis shocking video shows the moment a hunter threw a cataposs dead body over a garden fence after it was mauled to death by gun dogs. A man wearing a black riding helmet and carrying a whip was seen picking up rescue cat Mini and looking over his shoulder before tossing its body into a garden in Maldon, Cornwall. He arrived as a pack of eight hunting hounds were caught on video savaging the -year-old black tabby cat who belonged to resident Carly Jose, . Furious onlookers shouted after him b*****d and come here as he fled the rural housing estate following the incident in March. One woman can be heard yelling: What the hell have they done  Theyaposve got one of our cats. A male resident said: He threw it over my garden.  The hunter, dressed in a red hoodie, dark jeans and khaki wellies, was seen carrying what appeared to be a horsewhip in his left hand as left the area. Distressed residents called out from their homes as he began running towards a country footpath. Charlie Knight, who filmed the incident, chased the man onto a single-track road warning him that the incident was caught on video.  The man replied: Iaposm coming back in a minute mate. Iaposm just going to sort the hounds out and Iaposll be back. Leader of the hunt John Sampson, who owns a Cornish farm, was last week sentenced for being in charge of dogs that were dangerously out of control and fined £,. Ms Jose spoke of her joy and said it was a huge victory against the hunts. The court heard Sampson was exercising  hunting hounds at the time near the village before six or seven dogs fled into the housing estate where the incident happened. A petition titled Miniaposs law is now calling for the government to protect animals and the public from hunting activities such as trail hunts and hunting hound exercises.Ministers will debate the issue in Parliament after the petition gained more than , signatures. Responding to the petition, a government spokesperson said: The police can take action under the Dogs Act  where dogs are out of control and dangerous to other animals. This Government will not amend the Hunting Act. news uk-news simple-rock-paper-scissors-trick-"Rock Paper Scissors winning methodByEmily Sleight:,  Dec | commentsWe often resort to a good old game of rock paper scissors to make a decision, whether that’s what to have for dinner or who’s doing the washing up. Like flipping a coin, it’s a simple strategy that we assume is fair - especially as it doesn’t always go the way we want it to. However, there’s a simple trick that can make sure we win at the game every time - and it’s all about thinking ahead.As seen in a video by Numberphile, you can loosely use mathematics to ensure you’re always going to come up on top.There are two findings from the video featuring Dr. Hannah Fry, and those two findings could bag you a win.Winners always repeat their strategy Losers changeHannah explained: “This is the thing that you can exploit basically. If you lose, and your opponent won by playing rock, the chances are that they’ll play rock again. “You just lost on scissors, so you should play paper. Even though paper beats rock, you should go the other way round the triangle.” Basically,you’ve played scissors and they’ve played rock, you should play the thing that didn’t come up, which in this case, is rock. This is where things get a little sneaky, especiallyyou’ve won, and once you understand the method it’s very easy. Dr. Hannah Fry explains: “If you’ve won, they’re going to expect you to play the same thing again. “So they’re going to play the thing that would beat the thing that you’ve just played, so you need to play the thing that will beat the thing.”  Confused  You shouldn’t be, once you put this sneaky skill into practice, you’re bound to win every time - it’s all about thinking ahead. She continues: “Let’s imagine that you’ve just played rock and won, that means that they’ve played scissors and they’re going to think you’ve played rock again. “Which means that they’re going to play paper, which means that you should play scissors, you basically end up going backwards around the triangle.” This strategy is a combination of psychology and mathematics, and is defined as “rooted in game theory.” Hannah concludes: “It’s the mathematics of looking at decisions and strategies, and your best move is dependent on what the other person is playing, you can frame in game theory.” So next time you’re deciding what takeaway to get, make sure you stick with this tactic and you’re bound to get what you want.
